intro: Poikilacanthus gilliesii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, often with a distinctive yellow center. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its leaves are typically broad and hairy, adapted to withstand the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Poikilacanthus gilliesii is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
